\n\nTomato Egg Skillet@Mon Dec 04 22:24:.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 Tomato
2 Eggs
1/4 teaspoon Salt
1/4 teaspoon Pepper
1 tablespoon Olive Oil

Instructions:
1. Start by heating olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. 
2. Cut the tomato into quarter slices and add them to the skillet. 
3. Cook the tomato slices until lightly browned. 
4. Crack the eggs into a bowl, then add salt and pepper to the eggs. 
5. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and reduce the heat to medium-low. 
6. Stir the egg and tomato until the eggs are cooked and there are no raw egg pieces visible. 
7. Serve the egg and tomato dish hot. Enjoy!
\n\nTomato Egg Skillet@Mon Dec 04 22:24:.title: Tomato Egg Skillet

\n\nCheesy Apple Breakfast Bake@Tue Dec.recipe:
Ingredients:

- 4 ounces of cheese (grated)
- 2 apples (chopped)
- 1/4 cup of butter
- 2 tablespoons of honey
- 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon
- 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons of whole wheat flour
- 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder
-1/4 teaspoon of salt

Recipe:

1. Preheat oven to 350°F.

2. In a medium bowl, combine butter, honey, cinnamon, all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt, and mix until a dough forms.

3. Grease an 8×8-inch pan with butter or cooking spray.

4. Place the dough into the pan and spread it until it covers the entire bottom.

5. Top the dough with the grated cheese and chopped apples in an even layer.

6. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

7. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy!
\n\nCheesy Apple Breakfast Bake@Tue Dec.title: Cheesy Apple Breakfast Bake

\n\nCheesy Scramble Eggs@Tue Dec 05 14:3.recipe:
Ingredients: 
- 4 large eggs 
- 2 cups of shredded cheese

Instructions: 

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F.

2. Grease a 9-inch pie dish with butter or oil and set aside.

3. Beat the eggs in a medium-sized bowl until they’re light and fluffy.

4. Add the shredded cheese to the eggs and mix.

5. Pour the egg and cheese mixture into the prepared pie dish.

6. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

7. Serve and enjoy!
\n\nCheesy Scramble Eggs@Tue Dec 05 14:3.title: Cheesy Scramble Eggs

\n\nChicken and Egg Frittata@Tue Dec 05.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts 
- 2 hard boiled eggs 
- 2 scallions 
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise 
- 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard 
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil 
- 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar
- Salt and pepper to taste

Recipe: 

1. Preheat the oven to 350F.

2. Cut chicken breasts into cubes and season with salt and pepper.

3. Heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the cubed chicken and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes.

4. In a medium bowl, dice the hard boiled eggs and scallions.

5. Add the mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, and white wine vinegar to the bowl. Mix until ingredients are combined.

6. Place the cooked chicken in an oven-safe dish.

7. Pour the egg and mayonnaise mixture over the chicken and mix until ingredients are combined.

8. Place in the oven and bake for 25 minutes.

9. Serve and enjoy!
\n\nChicken and Egg Frittata@Tue Dec 05.title: Chicken and Egg Frittata

\n\nSlow-Cooked Barbecue Ribs@Tue Dec 05.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 rack of ribs
1 bottle of BBQ sauce
1/4 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup vegetable oil
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
2 tablespoons garlic powder
1 teaspoon black pepper

Instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F.

2. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

3. Place the rack of ribs on the baking sheet.

4. In a bowl, combine the BBQ sauce, brown sugar, vegetable oil, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and black pepper. Stir to combine.

5. Brush the mixture evenly over both sides of the ribs, making sure each rib is completely covered.

6. Bake the ribs in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes, until tender and cooked through.

7. Serve while hot. Enjoy!
\n\nSlow-Cooked Barbecue Ribs@Tue Dec 05.title: Slow-Cooked Barbecue Ribs

\n\nBacon and Ham Sandwich@Mon Dec 04 22.recipe:
Ingredients needed:
1-4 slices of Bacon 
1-2 slices of Ham 
2 slices of Bread 
Optional:
Mayonnaise
Mustard

Instructions:
1. Heat up the skillet on medium heat. 
2. Lay the bacon strips in the skillet and cook until both sides are lightly browned. 
3. After the bacon is done, set it aside and add the ham to the same skillet. 
4. Cook the ham until lightly browned, flipping it over once during the cooking process. 
5. Toast the two slices of bread in a toaster or a toaster oven.
6. Assemble the sandwich by spreading a thin layer of mayonnaise and/or mustard (one or both depending on preference) on each slice of bread.
7. Place the bacon and ham on one slice of bread and top it off with the other slice of bread. 
8. Enjoy your bacon and ham sandwich!
\n\nBacon and Ham Sandwich@Mon Dec 04 22.title: Bacon and Ham Sandwich
